org.swip.addPredicates
Class Conf

java.lang.Object
  org.swip.addPredicates.Conf

public class Conf
extends java.lang.Object

Manages the configuration file for AddPredicates.

For further explanations you can read the configuration file generated by this application.

Author:
Guillaume PEYET

Field Detail

logger

private static final org.apache.log4j.Logger logger
Used to log in console.

ignoredPrefixes

private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ignoredPrefixes
The program will ignore all resources which have the prefix in the list defined by this variable.

mode

private java.lang.String mode
Determines the execution mode of the program :
  • AUTO : the value of each added predicates are generated automatically, it is extracted from the URI's resource concerned.
  • SEMIAUTO : a value of each added predicates are generated automatically in the same way as in the AUTO mode, but you have the possibility to change it.
  • MAN : you must enter manually the value of each predicate added.

kbPath

private java.lang.String kbPath
Indicates the directory path where the knowledge base is located.

generatedPath

private java.lang.String generatedPath
Indicates the directory path in which the generated files will be put into.

searchedPredicate

private java.lang.String searchedPredicate
The program will add a predicate to each resource which have not the searchedPredicate defined.

addedPredicate

private java.lang.String addedPredicate
Represents the predicate that will be added.

Represents the configuration file path.

loadConf

public void loadConf(java.lang.String path)
              throws java.io.IOException
Reads and parses the configuration file. It tries to extract all required properties.

Parameters:
path - The path representing the configuration file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the configuration file cannot be read (with BurreredReader / BurreredWriter).
